item.title: Birushana: Winds of Fate coming west in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

The fan disc to Birushana: Rising Flower of Genpei.

Idea Factory International will release Red Entertainment-developed otome visual novel and Birushana: Winds of Fate fan disc Birushana: Winds of Fate for Switch both physically and digitally in 2026 in the west, the publisher announced.

Starting today, users can wishlist both the standard and “Plus” editions of the game via IFI’s Online Store. The contents of the Plus Edition will be announced at a later date.

Birushana: Winds of Fate first launched for Switch on March 31, 2022 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the game, via Idea Factory International:

About

Fifteen years after the Heiji Rebellion, the Heike clan has reached the height of its power, while the Genji clan remains devastated by defeat.

Hidden deep within the mountains of Kurama lives Shanao, the youngest surviving male heir to the Genji name. However, Shanao harbors a deep secret known to very few…

The youngest heir to the Genji name is no man.

Epilogues

With the war over, peace has finally returned to the land.

After our heroine carved out a new fate, these sweet epilogues tell the story of what happened after the events of the first game.

What does the future have in store for a girl who was born to fight?

Main Routes

New stories await our heroine…

The youngest child of the Genji, Shanao, has been driven out of Kyoto by the Heike.

What fate awaits her as she strives to hide her identity and live as a man in a world torn apart by war?

Key Features

  • We’re So Back – Beloved protagonist Shanao is back in this highly anticipated fan disc! Explore nine routes in total, including four Main Routes with all-new love interests, and five returning love interests in the Epilogues.
  • What Comes After – Pick up the story where the original Birushana: Rising Flower of Genpei ended in five epilogue routes. With love having bloomed on the battlefield, see what life is like for Shanao and her man of choice after the war has ended.
  • Turning a New Leaf – Return to the time of war in the all-new Main Routes. Featuring four new love interests, including the Sato brothers, relive moments from the first game from new perspectives and maybe even discover new romance.
  • This Action Will Have Consequences – Throughout the new Main Routes, you will have to make tough decisions. These choices will change your affection levels with certain characters and ultimately affect the outcome of your story. Which ending will you receive?

Watch the announcement trailer below. View a set of screenshots and box art at the gallery. Visit the official website here.

item.title: The Rogue Prince of Persia for Switch 2, Switch launches December 16; PS5, Switch 2, and Switch physical editions launch April 10, 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

Currently available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC.

The Switch 2 and Switch versions of The Rogue Prince of Persia will launch on December 16, publisher Ubisoft and developer Evil Empire announced.

Additionally, publishing partner U&I Entertainment announced that physical standard and “Immortal” editions of The Rogue Prince of Persia will launch for PlayStation 5, Switch, and Switch 2 on April 10, 2026. The Immortal Edition includes the game (a game-key card on Switch 2), a SteelBook case, a double-sided poster, and a set of fine art cards featuring imagery from the game on one side, with the reverse sides combining to form part of the game world map. Pre-orders for both editions will open on November 14.

“We’re thrilled to bring The Rogue Prince of Persia to Nintendo Switch players,” said Evil Empire game director Lucie Dewagnier in a press release. “The game’s fast-paced action and replayability make it a perfect fit for hybrid play. We can’t wait to see players dive into the Prince’s journey on the go.”

The Rogue Prince of Persia first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on May 27, 2024, followed by a full release across PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and Ubisoft Store on August 20, 2025. It is also available via the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog and Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via Ubisoft:

About

Experience a fast-paced, challenging but accessible roguelite as you master acrobatic moves and flow seamlessly between platforming and combat. Find new weapons, equip trinkets with special effects and upgrade them to make your own builds. Discover new characters, information and areas as you try to find a way to save Persia from a Hun invasion and become the hero you have always wanted to be.

Key Features

  • A Persia in Peril – Lead the Prince in his fight against a Hun army corrupted by dark shamanic magic and find your place in the royal family as you explore a vibrant reinterpretation of Persia. Put the pieces of the puzzle together and discover new areas as you enter the fight again and again, meeting a cast of colorful characters through non-linear story progression.
  • Become the Prince of Persia – Flow seamlessly between platforming and combat, using your acrobatic moves to outmaneuver and outsmart your enemies. Use the iconic wall-run to open new routes of attack, avoid traps and explore hard to reach areas. Kick and dodge to manage groups of enemies when the odds are against you.
  • Adapt and Improve on the Run – Choose from a variety of deadly weapons and equip new medallions each run to unleash devastating effects, giving you the freedom to change your fighting style as you wish. Secondary weapons offer even more options, from bows to shields to grappling hooks. Switch your loadout mid-run to adapt to new challenges.
  • Rise to Meet the Challenge – Unlock new weapons and medallions and learn from your mistakes to become more powerful with every death. New challenges await you each time as every level is procedurally generated, so no two runs are ever the same.
